content:
• Friday, August 24, 2018
  • CRK

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (8/24/2018)

    • Top Gainers: CRK +3.6%. SNR +3.3%. JT +3.2%. SUPV +3.1%. SONC +2.9%.
    • Top Losers: ACRS -5.1%. OTEX -2.3%. OZK -2.3%. BOFI -2.3%. QTM-OLD -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk closes at new all-time high after earnings

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) closed today up 15.3% to $152.20, a new all-time high.
    • The company reported stellar Q2 results that beat estimates and included guidance that met expectations.
    • Annualized recurring revenue from subscription plans grew 112% to $1.66B, continuing to show that the shift towards subscriptions has paid off. 
    • Previously: Autodesk +6.4% on Q2 beats, raised FY guide (Aug. 23)
    • Previously: Software stocks move after big day of earnings (Aug. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 5 Comments
  • ARNC

    Arconic reportedly in talks to sell itself: Reuters

    • Arconic (NYSE:ARNC) spiked late in trading to close up 4.5% after news broke that the company is in talks to sell itself, Reuters reports, citing people familiar with the matter. it's up 0.3% in after-hours trading.
    • Last month, the aluminum producer started a sale process for its building and construction business.
    • Arconic is reportedly talking with private equity firms including a consortium of Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and Carlyle Group (NASDAQ:CG), another consortium with KKR (NYSE:KKR) and Onex (OTCPK:ONEXF), and Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO).
    • Reuters said its sources warned that no deal may be reached as some of the firms have expressed doubts regarding Arconic's high price expectations.
    • Previously: Arconic seeks to sell unit that made panels in London's Grenfell fire (July 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 123 Comments
  • CI

    PBMs/drug distributors in the green after Cigna shareholders back Express Scripts deal

    • Drug wholesalers and pharmacy benefit managers are in the green. Earlier today, Cigna (CI -0.2%) shareholders voted overwhelmingly in favor of its planned merger with Express Scripts (ESRX +0.4%).
    • Selected tickers: (DPLO +0.5%)(CVS +0.5%)(UNH +1.2%)(CAH +1.1%)(ABC +0.1%)(MCK +0.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • SCWX

    SecureWorks -3.4% on UBS downgrade

    • UBS downgrades SecureWorks (NASDAQ:SCWX) from Neutral to Sell with an $11 price target.
    • Analyst Fatima Boolani thinks the valuation is pricing in better growth and operating leverage and is premium relative to history on lower EPS and FCF support.
    • SecureWorks shares are down 3.4% to $13.09, making this one of the few software stocks declining today.
    • Previously: Software stocks move after big day of earnings (Aug. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 22 Comments
  • ADSK

    Software stocks move after big day of earnings

    • Software stocks showing strength today after the earnings reports from Autodesk (ADSK +13.6%), Splunk (SPLK +14.9%), Veeva Systems (VEEV +12.7%), and Intuit (INTU +1.9%).  
    • Zuora (ZUO +9%) will report Q2 results aftermarket on August 30
    • Other movers include: (ADBE +1.9%), (CDAY +4.9%), (DATA +4.9%), (FNJN +4.6%), (PRO +4.1%), (WDAY +3.6%), (BSTI +3%), (WK +4.2%), (PVTL +3%), (OTC:DTRM +3.4%), (ZEN +3.3%), (PFPT +3.2%), (APPN +3.4%), (RNG +3.1%), (FEYE +3.3%), (MDB +2.8%), (QLYS +2.9%), (ZS +4.5%), (SAIL +3.1%), (NOW +4%). Related ETFs: IGV, PSJ, XSW
    • Previously: Veeva Systems reports Q2 beats, upside guides (Aug. 23)
    • Previously: Autodesk +6.4% on Q2 beats, raised FY guide (Aug. 23)
    • Previously: Needham boosts Splunk to 35% upside on Q2 strength (Aug. 24)
    • Previously: Workday +3.4% after OTR upgrade, Splunk's stellar earnings (Aug. 24)
    • Previously: Stifel boosts Intuit to 13% upside after earnings (Aug. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM | 19 Comments
  • VJET

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: VJET +17%. SPLK +16%. SITO +15%. ADSK +14%. VEEV +13%.
    • Losers: QD -12%. HMNY -12%. MOXC -12%. BBOX -11%. ABIL -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • ROSE

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: ROSE +14%. BRY +12%. USAS +9%. HL +9%. PVG +9%.
    • Losers: TUSK -15%. FGP -6%. CHNR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • DQ

    Daqo New Energy +8.3% on analyst initiation at 70% upside

    • Credit Suisse imitates Daqo New Energy (NYSE:DQ) with an Outperform rating and a price target of $58, a 70% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • DQ shares are up 8.3% to $36.93.   
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD could close at new 12-year high

    • AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) shares are up 5.7% and potentially heading for its highest close in nearly 12 years.
    • Shares closed at $24.23 on October 18, 2006, and currently sit at $23.55.
    • Yesterday, bullish Rosenblatt Securities analyst Hans Mosesmann hiked AMD’s price target to a new Street high on the “historical window of opportunity” presented with Intel’s (INTC +1.7%) 10nm delay. 
    • Cowen was also out with a research note saying that AMD’s likely to win business with cloud computing vendors wanting to diversify risk exposure to chip-specific security flaws.  
    • Previously: Intel, AMD moving on reveal of more Intel chip flaws (Aug. 14)
    • Previously: Rosenblatt boosts AMD target to new Street high (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 374 Comments
  • CIA

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: CIA +9%. PPDF +8%. ATLC +7%. LOOP +5%.
    • Losers: SUPV -21%. LEJU -9%. GGAL -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • GERN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: GERN +28%. SSC-OLD +27%. CVM +18%. SPLK +16%. CPIX +16%. CRON +16%. CNAT +15%. REED +15%. ADSK +15%. BRY +14%.
    • Losers: HIBB -29%. SUPV -21%. HMNY -16%. CBPO -16%. TUSK -14%. YECO-OLD -14%. FL -13%. MOXC -12%. JMU -12%. QD -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 6 Comments
  • REED

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: REED +11%. FFHL +8%. RIBT +5%. FAMI +5%.
    • Losers: FL -13%. FLXS -9%. KOSS -8%. CLW -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • FFHL

    Fuwei Films up 9% after Q2 results

    • Fuwei Films (FFHL +9.5%) reported Q2 revenue growth of 13.6% Y/Y to RMB79.6M, with overseas sales at RMB16.6M (+5.1% Y/Y).
    • Segment sales: Stamping and transfer film RMB29.43M (+11.6% Y/Y); Printing films RMB11.71M (+121.5% Y/Y); Metallization film RMB622k (-74.5% Y/Y); Specialty film RMB30.75M (+20.3% Y/Y) and Base film for other application RMB7.09M (-31.5% Y/Y).
    • Q2 Gross margin improved by 137 bps to 8.5% and operating margin recovered by 490 bps to -8.2%.
    • Average product sales price increased by 11% Y/Y and average cost of goods sold increased by 9.7% Y/Y.
    • Net cash provided by operating activities was RMB20.49M compared to RMB529k a year ago.
    • Company has cash and cash equivalents of RMB62.9M as of June 30, 2018.
    • Previously: Fuwei Films reports Q2 results (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • CDMO

    Avid Bio up 8%

    • Avid Bioservices (CDMO +7.7%) is trying to break out of a four-week base, albeit on below-average volume.
    • The company should be reporting fiscal Q1 results sometime in October. Consensus view is a loss/share of ($0.13) on revenues of $9M. The company expects to generate $51M - 55M in revenues in fiscal 2019.
    • At the end of fiscal 2018 (April), it had $42.3M in cash and equivalents. Operations consumed $24M during the fiscal year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • LBTYA

    Liberty Global +3.3% as UBS lifts to Buy

    • Liberty Global (NASDAQ:LBTYA) is up 3.3% after an upgrade to Buy at UBS.
    • The firm expects increased operating cash flow ahead and points out that shares are at their lowest point in six years.
    • It's updated its price target lower, though, to $33.50 from $37, which currently implies 25% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • STG

    Sunlands Online Education down 2.7% post Q2 results

    • Sunlands Online Education (STG -2.7%) reports Q2 revenue growth of 134.1% Y/Y to RMB481.8M, the increase was mainly driven by the growth in new student enrollments.
    • Adj. gross billings were RMB796.6M (+53.8% Y/Y); New student enrollments were 133,887 (+63.2% Y/Y).
    • Gross profit increased by 119.6% Y/Y to RMB393.3M, but margin declined by 540 bps to 81.6%.
    • Adj. EBIDTA was –RMB133.9M from –RMB281.6M Y/Y; Deferred revenue was RMB2,893.5M.
    • Cash & equivalents of RMB1,419.2M & Short-term investments of RMB926.9M.
    • Capex was RMB97.3M from RMB2.6M Y/Y, the increase was mainly due to purchases of buildings & leasehold improvements.
    • Q3 Outlook: Net revenues of RMB500-520M, which would represent an increase of 89.4%-96.9% Y/Y.
    • Previously: Sunlands Online Education beats on revenue (Aug. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • GERN

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (08/24/2018)

    • Gainers: GERN +29%. CRON +15%. TLRY +11%. CDMO +10%. CNAT +9%.
    • Losers: CBPO -14%. TNXP -9%. ADXS -7%. NCNA -6%. OMED -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • UNCRY

    Unicredit reportedly hires adviser for possible merger with SocGen

    • Italian bank UniCredit SpA (OTCPK:UNCRY +0.9%) reportedly has hired an adviser for a possible merger with France's Societe Generale (OTCPK:SCGLY +1.4%).
    • Italian financial newspaper MF says talks between the banks about integration and acquisition possibilities are continuing.
    • Speculation about such a merger originally started about two years ago, when Jean Pierre Mustier took over as CEO of Unicredit.
    • Related tickers: OTCPK:UNCFF, OTCPK:UNCFY, OTCPK:SCGLF
    • Previously: UniCredito Spa reports Q2 results (Aug. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games +2.6% on Caesars sports betting launch

    • Scientific Games (NASDAQ:SGMS) and Caesars Entertainment launch sports betting at locations in Mississippi.
    • Scientific Games shares are up 2.6% to $31.50.        
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ERIC

    Ericsson +3.8% on Liberum upgrade to Buy

    • Ericsson (NASDAQ:ERIC) is up 3.8% in Nasdaq trading after an upgrade to Buy at Liberum, which sees margins improving amid benefits from an upcoming 5G cycle.
    • The company is benefiting from a narrower focus from CEO Borje Ekholm, the firm says, and revenues will grow from rising 5G spending in the U.S. as well as Korea, Japan and China in 2019-2020. It's a "defensive investment with steady upside in an uncertain macro environment," Liberum says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The firm raised its price target to 85 kronor from 65, implying 9% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar signs solar module supply agreement with Powerchina Huadong Engineering Corporation

    • JinkoSolar Holding (JKS +3.9%) has signed a 240MW solar module supply agreement with POWERCHINA Huadong Engineering Corporation Limited for the second phase of the 420 MW Dau Tieng solar plant in Vietnam.
    • The project will become the largest solar power project in Southeast Asia when completed.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • VEEV

    KeyBanc boosts its Veeva Systems target after earnings

    • KeyBanc maintains an Overweight rating on Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) after earnings and raises the price target from $84 to $99.
    • Analyst Brent Bracelin cites the accelerated growth at the highest rate in a year backed by a strengthening portfolio. 
    • The firm is “particularly encouraged by the first seven-figure customer outside of life sciences” and sees it as an “early proof point” for the QualityOne opportunity. 
    • Veeva shares are up 9.3% to $97.79.       
    • Previously: Veeva Systems reports Q2 beats, upside guides (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 2 Comments
  • RTW

    New York & Company up 4.3% post Q2 results

    • New York & Company (NWY +4.3%) reports Q2 revenue decrease of 3.5% Y/Y to $216.3M.
    • Comparable store sales increased 0.6%, representing the fourth consecutive quarter of positive comparable store sales.
    • Comparable store sales increase of 1.7% for the spring season.
    • Gross margin increased 150 bps to 32.1%.
    • Spring adj. operating income of $7.8M exceeds guidance.
    • For spring season, adj. EBITDA was $18.7M.
    • Reports $94.8M in cash with no debt outstanding.
    • Capex for the spring season was $1.6M (-66% Y/Y).
    • The Company opened 1 outlet store, converted 2 existing New York & Company stores to outlet stores, closed 5 New York & Company stores and 2 outlet stores.
    • Remodeled 3 existing locations ending the Spring season with 426 stores, including 120 Outlet stores and 2.1M selling square feet in operation.
    • Q3 Outlook: GAAP gross margin to increase by 50-150 bps; GAAP operating income of $1-2M & capex of $4-6M.
    • 2018 Outlook: For the fall season, combined Q3 & Q4 2018, the Company expects comparable store sales to increase in the low single-digit range; GAAP operating income of $5.5-7.5M; capex of $10-11M.
    • Previously: New York & Company beats by $0.03, misses on revenue (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • DKS

    Skittish trading on Dick's ahead of earnings

    • Disappointing earnings from Foot Locker and Hibbett Sports has investors scrambling with what to do with Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS -4.5%) ahead of the retailer's own Q2 report next week.
    • Lackluster comparable sales growth at Foot Locker and trimmed guidance from Hibbett are the two warnings shots being watched.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • FLXS

    Flexsteel Industries down 8% post Q4 results

    • Flexsteel Industries (FLXS -8.8%) reported Q4 sales decrease of 3.7% Y/Y to $113.1M, with Residential sales at $95.8M (-3.5% Y/Y) and Contract at $17.3M (-4.4% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Gross margin declined by 777 bps to 15.1% and operating margin declined by 540 bps to 2.4%.
    • SG&A expenses declined by 18.9% Y/Y to $14.35M and margin was 12.7% down by 240 bps.
    • Inventories were at $96.2M (-3.2% Y/Y).
    • Net cash provided by operating activities was $27.29M, compared to $26.39M a year ago.
    • Company had cash and cash equivalents of $27.75M as of June 30, 2018.
    • Flexsteel completed first of two deployments to new SAP S/4 HANA business information system in Q4, and saw a sales decline of 37% in products sold to e-commerce customers, due to the transition to the new business information system.
    • 1Q19 Outlook: Sales growth of mid-single digits in 1Q19; Capex $9M and SG&A expense of $3M.
    • Previously: Flexsteel reports Q4 results (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • CMCL

    Caledonia increases its shareholding in Blanket Mine

    • Caledonia (CMCL +2.1%) has entered into an MOU with Fremiro to purchase Fremiro’s 15% shareholding in Blanket for a gross consideration of $16.667M.
    • Post transaction, Caledonia will have a 64% shareholding in Blanket and Fremiro will hold 6.42% of Caledonia’s diluted equity.
    • Caledonia remains on track to achieve the production target of 80,000 ounces by 2021 at the mine operated by its Zimbabwean subsidiary, Blanket.
    • Steve Curtis, CEO: “Blanket Mine has been an excellent investment for Caledonia since we originally invested in Zimbabwe in 2006 and we are delighted to be able to increase our shareholding in this outstanding asset".
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • RAVN

    Raven adds to FQ2 results-stoked rally, up 5%

    • Thinly traded Raven Industries (RAVN +4.9%) is up on below-average volume in early trade. Shares have rallied over 26% this week. On Wednesday, it released better-than-expected fiscal Q2 results. Highlights:
    • Sales: $102.7M (+18.6%); net income: $13.7M (+67.1%); EPS: $0.38 (+52.2%).
    • Engineered films sales up 20% to $58.9M.
    • Cash flow ops (6 mo.): $38.7M (+94.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACIA

    Acacia Communications -6% on BofAML downgrade to Underperform

    • Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) is 6% lower after a downgrade to Underperform at BofA Merrill Lynch.
    • Analyst Tal Liani has a $37 price target, now implying 5% further downside from today's lower price.
    • Shares had risen 8.2% yesterday amid Piper Jaffray bullishness on an expected return of Chinese demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday +3.4% after OTR upgrade, Splunk's stellar earnings

    • OTR Global upgrades Workday (NYSE:WDAY) from Mixed to Positive.
    • Workday shares are up 3.4% to $150.58 also getting a boost from fellow enterprise software provider Splunk’s stellar earnings report.   
    • MongoDB (MDB +1.1%), Teradata (TDC +0.8%), and Cloudera (CLDR +2.1%) are among the companies that could also get a boost from the Splunk report.    
    • Previously: Splunk +9.8% on Q2 beats, upside revenue guides (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • EROS

    Eros International wins dismissal of class action

    • Eros International (NYSE:EROS) has won dismissal of a class action suit pursued against the company and its officers and directors.
    • The suit was originally filed in November 2015, and it went to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit last October.
    • Share are retrenching a bit today, down 2.3% after rising 4.8% yesterday on NYSE following a beat of profit expectations in its Q1.
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • DBX

    Dropbox -6.2% after lockup period expiration

    • Dropbox (NASDAQ:DBX) shares drop 6.2% to $26.61 on the expiration of the lockup period.
    • Dropbox shares are up 0.4% in the past week, down 9.5% in the month, and down 0.5% YTD since the IPO.       
    • Previously: Dropbox +1.7% ahead of lockup expiration (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 43 Comments
  • GERN

    Geron up 42% on expectations of J&J continuing with imetelstat

    • Geron (GERN +42.2%) is up on double normal volume in apparent response to a job posting for a pricing manager whose duties will include a setting a pricing approach for imetelstat, implying that its Janssen unit will continue development.
    • Janssen is expected to notify Geron on its decision this quarter.
    • Previously: Geron down 13% in early trading on extended timeline for imetelstat study, risk that Janssen will bail (Aug. 1, 2017)
    • Update: J&J told Bloomberg that the job posting does not have anything to do with its licensing deal with Geron. The job specs encompass the range of responsibilities that are "consistent" with Janssen's blood cancer portfolio. GERN is still up 27% heading into the last hour of trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 171 Comments
  • SPLK

    Needham boosts Splunk to 35% upside on Q2 strength

    • Needham maintains a Buy rating on Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) and raises the price target from $127 to $145 (35% upside) after strong Q2 results.
    • Analyst Jack Andrews says the best way to see Splunk’s business momentum is to “add the company’s software revenue (including both license and cloud) to the change in RPO (revenue performance obligation).” 
    • For Q2, the calculation equates to $316M compared to $205.5M in last year’s quarter, up 54% Y/Y.   
    • Splunk shares are up 9.1% premarket to $117.50.    
    • Previously: Splunk +9.8% on Q2 beats, upside revenue guides (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • MDXG

    Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am (08/24/2018)

    • OTC:MDXG +11% as EpiFix shows effectiveness in healing diabetic foot ulcers.
    • ADSK +11% on Q2 result.
    • SSC-OLD +10%.
    • SPLK +9% on Q2 result.
    • ICHR +8% as it heads to SmallCap 600.
    • CRON +7%.
    • BKE +6% on Q2 result.
    • PTX +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 9 Comments
  • HIBB

    Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am (8/24/2018)

    • HIBB -20% on Q2 earnings.
    • OBLN -11%.
    • CBPO -11% on rejecting takeover bids.
    • SUPV -8% on Q2 earnings.
    • GPS -8% on Q2 earnings.
    • LEJU -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • SHPG

    Shire announces cash tender offers for up to $2.25B outstanding notes

    • Shire plc (NASDAQ:SHPG), Baxalta Incorporated, and Shire Acquisitions Investments Ireland DAC, have commenced cash tender oﬀers to purchase up to $2.25B aggregate principal amount of Baxalta's outstanding 2.875% Senior Notes due 2020, 3.600% Senior Notes due 2022, 4.000% Senior Notes due 2025 and 5.250% Senior Notes due 2045 and SAIIDAC's outstanding 3.200% Senior Notes due 2026.
    • The Tender Oﬀers will expire at 11:59 p.m., New York City time, on September 21. Tendered Notes may be withdrawn prior to, 5:00 p.m., New York City time, on September 7.
    • Shares are up 2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • MDXG

    MiMedx's EpiFix shows effectiveness in healing diabetic foot ulcers; shares up 7% premarket

    • MiMedx Group (OTC:MDXG) is up 7% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a study evaluating EpiFix in patients with diabetic foot ulcers (DFUs). The data were just published in the International Wound Journal.
    • 70% (n=77/110) of patients in the intent-to-treat group receiving weekly EpiFix experienced complete healing by week 12 compared to 50% of patients receiving standard-of-care (SOC) treatment (p=0.0338).
    • 81% (n=79/98) of the patients receiving EpiFix who completed the study per protocol experienced complete healing by week 12 versus 55% for SOC (p=0.0093).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 61 Comments
  • SUPV

    Grupo Supervielle slumps 12% after worse-than-expected Q2 results

    • Grupo Supervielle (NYSE:SUPV) falls 12% in premarket trading after announcing worse-than-expected Q2 results and cutting its full-year guidance.
    • It also disclosed a plan to streamline its consumer finance business to adjust to the new macro environment in Argentina.
    • Q2 attributable comprehensive income of Argentine Pesos 475.3M fell 36% Q/Q and 11% Y/Y; Q2 earnings AR$2.96 per ADR vs AR$7.91 in Q1 and AR$6.94 a year earlier.
    • Q2 net interest margin of 19.2% vs. 19.6% in Q1 and 21.5% a year ago.
    • Net interest income AR$2.90B, up 2.8% from Q1 and up 49% Y/Y.
    • Results were worse than expected due to lower-than-anticipated margins in its consumer finance business, softer results from banking business due to loan repricing lag, and lower trading results, including a short position its trading desk had on FX at the onset of the AR$ devaluation.
    • Q2 pesos/US% exchange rate 28.85 vs 20.14 in Q1 and 16.60 in Q2 2017.
    • Actions taken to tighten credit and streamline its consumer finance business won't be enough to offset weak Q2 results, the higher cost of funds and lower loan growth in consumer finance, says Chairman and CEO Patricio Supervielle."As a result, we are revising downwards our guidance for the year," he said. The company didn't disclose the guidance in its statement.
    • Consumer finance reorganization: Its four consumer finance units--Cordial Compañía Financiera, Espacio Cordial de Servicios, Tarjeta Automática, and recently acquired Micro Lending--will be managed by Juan Martin Monteverdi, current CEO of Espacio Cordial de Servicios.
    • As a result, Carlos Depalo is stepping down as CEO of  Cordial Compañía Financiera and Tarjeta Automática and will leave the company.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Grupo Supervielle reports Q2 results (Aug. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 9 Comments
  • CGNX

    Northcoast steps to sideline on Cognex

    • Northcoast downgrades Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) from Buy to Neutral.  
    • Cognex shares are down 1.3% premarket to $52.25. 
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • CBPO

    China Biologic rejects takeover bids, raises $590M in new capital; shares down 11% premarket.

    • China Biologic Products Holdings (NASDAQ:CBPO) reports that CITIC Capital MB Investment Limited has withdrawn its non-binding takeover proposal date June 11 which appeared to be inadequate in CBPO's opinion.
    • The board rejected the non-binding takeover proposal dated August 17 from an investor group led by former Chairman & CEO David Gao saying the bid undervalued the company.
    • And finally, CBPO has inked agreements with certain institutional investors for the direct sale of 5.85M newly issued shares expected to yield gross proceeds of ~$590M ($100.85/share). The new capital will be used to support its expansion plans and acquisitions.
    • Shares are down 11% premarket on light volume.
    • Previously: China Biologic Products up 16% premarket on $110/share offer (June 18)
    • Previously: China Biologic up 18% premarket on $118/share bid (Aug. 20)
    • Update: In a statement, the Gao-led investment group says it is "deeply disappointed" that CBPO's board rejected its proposal before the private placement of stock at a price well below its bid, adding that it is "evaluating all our options, including legal action."
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 4 Comments

    Qudian +5.5% after Q2 beat, reassures Ant Financial loss won't hurt results

    • Qudian (NYSE:QD) +5.5% in premarket trading as Q2 non-GAAP income of 34 cent per ADS beat consensus estimate of 24 cents and after the company says the loss of its partnership with Ant Financial won't materially hurt its business.
    • Yesterday, QD fell 11% after reports that Ant Financial wasn't renewing the partnership.
    • Reaffirmed full-year guidance for non-GAAP net income of more than RMB 2.5B.
    • It pulled back on expectations for Dabai Auto unit sales. "With delinquency managed within expected ranges and volume growing healthily on the consumption credit side, we hope to grow the Dabai Auto business at a more prudent pace and lower expected unit sales from 100,000 units to between 25,000-30,000 units," says Min Luo, founder, chairman, and CEO.
    • Board changes: To comply with NYSE corporate governance standards, Qudian named Rong Shengwen to its board as an independent director. Du Li resigned from the board.

  • ENB

    Enbridge to acquire Spectra Energy Partners in stock deal valued at $3.3B

    • Enbridge (NYSE:ENB) and Spectra Energy Partners (NYSE:SEP) agree to a deal in which Enbridge will pay 1.111 common shares of its stock for each SEP common unit..
    • The ratio represents a 9.8% boost to the exchange ratio offered by Enbridge on May 17 of 1.0123 ENB shares per SEP common unit, and values the acquisition at US$3.3B (C$4.3B), based on Enbridge's closing price on Aug. 23, 2018.
    • SEP +2.4% in premarket trading; ENB -0.3%.
    • Based on the agreed exchange ratio, Enbridge would issue an estimated 91.0M Enbridge common shares in connection with the transaction, representing about 5% of the total number of Enbridge common shares outstanding.
    • Deal expected to close in Q4 2018.
    • If the transaction isn't completed before the record date of SEP's Q4 distribution, SEP is expected to pay a cash distribution to unitholders in Q4 consistent with previously disclosed guidance.
    • Enbridge sees no change to consolidated EBITDA after the merger because the assets held by SEP are already managed and operated by Enbridge's U.S. subsidiaries and consolidated for accounting purposes by Enbridge.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Spectra Energy Partners -3% after Enbridge's disappointing offer (May 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM | 115 Comments
